topic_title: AWS CloudFormation AutoScaling EBS Block Device Property Type

variables.description: Indicates whether to delete the volume when the instance is terminated. By                   default, Auto Scaling uses true.
variables.name: DeleteOnTermination

variables.description: The number of I/O operations per second (IOPS) that the volume supports. The                   maximum ratio of IOPS to volume size is 30.
variables.name: Iops

variables.description: The snapshot ID of the volume to use.
variables.name: SnapshotId
variables.required: Conditional If you specify both SnapshotId and                      VolumeSize, VolumeSize must be equal or greater than                   the size of the snapshot.

variables.description: The volume size, in Gibibytes (GiB). This can be a number from 1 - 1024.                   If the volume type is EBS optimized, the minimum value is 10. For more information                   about specifying the volume type, see EbsOptimized in AWS::AutoScaling::LaunchConfiguration.
variables.name: VolumeSize
variables.required: Conditional If you specify both SnapshotId and                      VolumeSize, VolumeSize must be equal or greater than                   the size of the snapshot.

variables.description: The volume type. By default, Auto Scaling uses the standard volume type.                   For more information, see Ebs in the Auto Scaling API Reference.
variables.name: VolumeType
